TopicTitle: Devnote Tuesday: Where did we leave the bugspray?

Articles.Content: sorry if I overlooked it but whats Porkjet been up to?

11 hours ago, SQUAD said:
Another nice surprise recently was the interest of the mainstream British media have taken into Kerbal Space Program, which no doubt has a relation with Tim Peake’s presence aboard the International Space Station. Space is all the rage in the UK right now and rightly so. Therefore we’re setting aside a little time from Ted, Kasper (KasperVld) and Andie (Badie) so that they can work with the media and set up some interviews. Working with non-gaming press on items related to KSP is a new experience to us, and it’ll be interesting to see how it works out.

Re this bit I thought of Kerbal last night as the UK aired the opening episode of (sixth season) "Stargazing Live". It's the sort of programming that the BBC does really well - real science, approachable but not patronising. Anyway they had a big segment on reaction wheels, including "levitating" a garden shed but far more impressively a video link with Tim Peake aboard the ISS playing with a kid's gyroscope in orbit - even though you know (kinda) how they work, a toy gyro operating in orbit is spooky close to witchcraft. Lots of stuff on Pluto & the 67P comet too, with really enthused knowledgeable proper grownup professors - but remaining accessible and exciting to all.

Anyway BBC iPlayer link is http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b019h4g8/episodes/player - I appreciate that folks outside the UK may have difficulty accessing it without resorting to nefarious means due to the unique way the Beeb is funded, but suspect Squad's media contacts may be able to wrangle a private viewing for ideas
I know bug fixing as a very very satisfying task

13 hours ago, Hobbes Novakoff said:

Achievements... Not sure where exactly I stand there. On the one hand, it's cool for new players to get recognition. On the other hand, KSP is a certain kind of game. It's not like, say, Portal-something that you pick up, play for a while, then put back down. People play KSP for months, even years. Acheivements in that case would just be a mark of how long you've played, becuase there's only so many challenges you can make up. 

I disagree, achievements can be a measure of how far you've gone in a specific savegame (at least as I understand it; SQUAD has been reluctant to add Steam-like achievements so I read that to mean like the World First contracts and stuff). That makes it suitable for setting personal objectives or challenges.

If achievement integration into PC was just a "Hall of Milestones" with a list of the World's Firsts (or whatever is tracked in the end), (sort of like the science archives) I'd be pretty happy. The little beeping in the corner when a World's First contract is completed is a nice way to do it I think--it's not at all intrusive, but you can still check the status of it in flight. I think keeping some sort of record of who was first in orbit, or first kerbal on each body would be welcome generally. I don't want: a master list of achievements (aka it lists unfulfilled things), a notification in flight that would ruin immersion.

 

I'd also add that for certain achievements (such as landing on the mun), it'd be nice if it were made more robust. If I bounce my first landing, I don't want to achieve both "landing" and "take-off" from the mun--likewise, if I land and then tip over/break an engine/etc, I don't want my sudden terror of messing up to be spoiled by "Congratulations! You've landed on the Mun!"

 

 

Edited January 13, 2016 by kujuman

14 hours ago, SQUAD said:

The map view was very reliant on the old and deprecated OnGUI system

Hm, never heard about unity deprecating IMGUI. So, what are you going to use now? Should add-ons also move to something else?

Every time I heard about adding an achievements I go back to this article that explains why Don't Starve doesn't have any link
 tldr; intrinsic rewards are more important than giving the player medals for playing.

Yes, KSP already has a sort of "achievement system" in the form of World's First Records, but they aren't as prominent as things like Steam achievements, and you can't see what records you didn't complete yet, so is much easy to ignore and set your own goals.

43 minutes ago, kujuman said:

I'd also add that for certain achievements (such as landing on the mun), it'd be nice if it were made more robust. If I bounce my first landing, I don't want to achieve both "landing" and "take-off" from the mun--likewise, if I land and then tip over/break an engine/etc, I don't want my sudden terror of messing up to be spoiled by "Congratulations! You've landed on the Mun!"

Nah, that's be "you impacted the Mun!"

Seriously though, as a dev myself, I've been bashing my head for a couple hours about how I'd differentiate in code between a successful landing and "land, bounce, tipover, thud"

I guess I'd insist the craft be upright (within a 45 deg cone of local vertical) and no break-off events in the last 30 seconds, or something like that. Defining upright might be difficult, as a craft might launch vertical and land horizontal like a shuttle.

It would have to be robust because people go *batsh-t* *crazy* on consoles when achievements "glitch" - i.e. they fulfill the requirements but don't get the achievement. I follow Achievement Hunter and a bunch of other non-KSP Lets-Players and this is a "I'd stab my mother over that" level of "sore point"

Edit: mainly because a lot of achievements are seriously difficult, and to do the work but not get it... well, you get stabby.

Edited January 13, 2016 by GeneCash

Wow, it's the funniest anti-achievement reasoning I've read in a while.

 

Achievement systems are useful in many ways.

First, one can brag to one's friends like 'Hey, bro, check out my new 'Launch a vessel' achievement, bet you won't get that evah!'

Also, achievements are essential in a situation like that:

Some 'l337 r0ck37 5c13n7157' appears, all nerdy, term-toting n' stuff, humiliating you with some nerdy words like 'apoapsis'. Without achievements you're kinda screwed, there's nothing you can do with such an intellectual. With achievement system you can be just like - 'Go get 'Land on the Mun' fist noob, and be nerdy later, lel.' Congrats, you just won an argument on the internets!

 

P.S. On a bit more serious note - you know, Steam overlay can be turned off, right?

I'm honestly pretty proud of the fact that I've unlocked all of the achievements in Borderlands 2. Some of them are awesome, some of them are participation, I like the ones that are easter eggs or funny for random reasons.
